abstract: Iran officials ask organizers of upcoming Frankfurt Book Fair to cancel scheduled speech by Salman Rushdie because they cannot retract 1989 order given to Muslims to kill him; Islamic religious leader and Iranian republic founder Ayatollah Khomeini deemed book blasphemous and died months after issuing death order.
lead_paragraph: In 1989, Ayatollah Khomeini, the founder of the Islamic republic, ordered Muslims to kill Mr. Rushdie after some deemed his book blasphemous.

headline.main: Iran: Officials Object to Event With Salman Rushdie
headline.print_headline: Iran: Officials Object to Event With Salman Rushdie

snippet: In 1989, Ayatollah Khomeini, the founder of the Islamic republic, ordered Muslims to kill Mr. Rushdie after some deemed his book blasphemous.
